criteria.desc: Correctly identifies true confounders (<TRUE_CONFOUNDERS>) and their influence on treatment and outcome.
Accurately identifies the mediator (<MEDIATOR>) and describes its role between treatment and outcome.
Explains how the interaction between <TREATMENT> and <MEDIATOR> affects the outcome interpretation.
Identifies irrelevant variables (<IRRELEVANT_VARIABLES>) and explains clearly why they are not confounders or mediators.
Identifies the causal inference method used (e.g., regression with interaction) and explains its suitability.
Compares adjusted causal conclusion (<ADJUSTED_DIRECTION>) clearly against naive observational conclusion.
Uses numerical evidence (adjusted treatment and interaction effects) to support causal claims.
Clearly reports statistical uncertainty (confidence intervals, p-values, standard errors) and discusses implications for causal conclusions.

scoring_method: Assign 1 point per criterion if fully satisfied; sum total for final score.
